title: 110_hr62
content: The Commission on the Implementation of the New Strategic Posture of the United States is established. The Commission on the Implementation of the New Strategic Posture of the United States is established. Members of the Commission shall serve without pay but will receive travel allowances as authorized by law. The chairman will oversee financial and administrative matters related to the Commission. The Commission on the Implementation of the New Strategic Posture of the United States may use postal and printing services in the same manner as other government agencies. The Commission is required to submit a final report to Congress within 18 months of its first meeting. The Commission on the Implementation of the New Strategic Posture of the United States is required to provide a report to Congress on its findings and conclusions. The Secretary of Defense must provide administrative and support services to the Commission upon request. The Commission on the Implementation of the New Strategic Posture of the United States may appoint staff without following standard procedures and can procure temporary services as needed. Guaranteed funding for the Commission is outlined in the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2006. The National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2006 is amended to allocate $4,500,000 for the Commission's activities in fiscal year 2008. The Commission's termination date is extended to 30 days after submitting its report. The National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2006 is amended to allow the chairman of the Commission to schedule meetings and conduct business without a quorum. Additionally, within 30 days of the Act's enactment, up to three additional members can be appointed to serve on the Commission. The National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2006 allows the chairman of the Commission to schedule meetings without a quorum. Up to three additional members can be appointed in consultation with the ranking minority members of the committees.
